( Carnage: I am so very sorry for not RPing for the few past weeks. My 
computer had decided to smelt on me and it has been in the shop for those 
weeks in which I was not able to RP. But now it is activating at it�s top 
functional peek and I shall be RPing regularly. I do apologize for any 
frustration this has caused. And Fire Fox, it�s nice to see you back.)


* Dinobot had watched both Necromancer and Hell Drak disappear into the 
distance in the direction of the Cybertronian Fire, their huge shapes 
eventually fading into the growing blackness of the night despite the moons 
silver rays.
Necromancer�s and Hell Drak�s appearance had been a complete surprise to him 
despite his honed senses which were turned to all which was around him, 
finally coming to the conclusion that it was his damage and fatigue which 
seemed to be dulling his abilities.
And with a growl he acknowledged that it would also be his downfall if he 
was in need of engaging in battle any time soon. However, he hoped that he 
would be able to avoid battle until he was fully repaired. For, what was the 
point of battle if you couldn�t engage in it?
Though his joints were stiff from the rescue earlier that day, the tree 
hopping and the wound on his chest still bled freely, he knew that it would 
only be a short time now until they would be on the move again and heading 
in the same direction as the two giant Maximal dragons that had disappeared 
in the distance.
Dinobot took in a deep breath of the crisp night air into his metallic lungs 
before turning his head in Tavatrons direction, simply finding her in the 
same position as before by the stream which split this glade in two.
By the look of her posture and the slow but steady rise of her back it 
wasn�t hard too see that she was asleep, and he would let her continue to be 
so until the time came when they would be moving on.
The Transmetal II warrior lifted his optics from the sleeping fembot and let 
them wander over the calm and serene atmosphere of the gentle glade, 
ignoring the pain of his wounded chest in order to try and forget it all 
together.
Though, throughout it all, his mind wanderer just as freely as his optics 
did.
She sight of Tavatron sleeping so peacefully reminded him of his own 
fatigue, thinking to himself just what it was like to be able to sleep 
without having to worry about scenes of terror and carnage every time on 
closed their optics. It was either those or darkness, never anything more. 
But he also guessed that it was just one of the side effects to living the 
life of war, such as he did.
It was also probably a sign that he had been at this warrior business a bit 
too long, but he hadn�t given it up then and he wasn�t about to now. Simply 
knowing that he would never be happy doing anything else. Besides, he didn�t 
know anything more then the stench of the battlefield, the screams of the 
wounded and dying, the clash of steel and the war cries and the feeling of 
triumph when the battle was won and a bot could go home to their families.
Dinobot stretched the stiffness out of his joints before walking over the 
large stump he had stood on when he had first entered this place, simply 
setting himself onto it and leaning his back against a small sapling which 
was growing right beside it. Sitting sideways so that he could keep an optic 
on the glade as well as the woods.
Ah yes, families. Ones to come home to after a heard day on the field.
Though, he had never been part of one worth coming home to.
His father had died in battle when he was very young and his mother never 
wanted him in the first place, later having another offspring that she 
thought all the world of.
And with all her time spent dwelling on that new brat he was completely 
shoved off to the side, forgotten and left out in the cold.
And bots wondered why he had such a bad attitude?!
Some family he had.
His own mother even hid the fact that he was that slaging things older 
brother for the longest time, finally leaving it up to HIM to tell the 
little slag.
And all his life he had tried to prove to her that he was something, 
something that she could be proud of and would be welcome.
But he tried and he tried and still she ignored him and he gave up, so�he 
left. Joining the Predacon forces as his father before him had and made a 
warrior out of himself.
Dinobot almost chuckled.
Slag! Was his mother ever surprised when this seasoned warrior suddenly 
appeared on her doorstep and claimed to be the scrawny son that she had 
neglected all those years.
She had been beside herself in surprise but had accepted the fair share of 
earnings he had made as a hired sword when he gave it to her, knowing that 
by then she was nearly bankrupt and without a home. She was his mother, 
after all, though, honor also had a large part in that as well.
But after that he had left with nothing more then a farewell, simply going 
back to what he loved the most and was more a mother to him then his own 
ever was�BATTLE! And he hadn�t been back since.
But since those times things had changed, more then he cared to admit.
But that little tale was just one of his darkest secrets, one that he never 
told to anybot for any reason. Knowing that they would either laugh at him 
or pity him greatly.
Though, maybe in some far off time he would tell somebot, one that he 
trusted without end and felt completely confident in telling.
But it was also a memory that he didn�t even bother care about anymore, the 
pain of past years dulled until they simply weren�t there anymore.
But there, sitting atop that stump was a transformer that was completely 
honed by battle and having to deal with his earlier years. His attitude not 
even having to do with the past any longer, just kept so long that it 
finally became�him.
Dinobot took in another breath of crisp night air; but all those problems 
were in the past and he knew that it was far better to live in the present 
and leave the past where it belonged�behind him.
A thrush skittering from it�s cover near by causing his head to snap in it�s 
direction, all that he had thought of safely tucked away in the back of his 
mind and forgotten.
The sudden urge to go and hunt at the sight of game, ( no matter HOW small 
), caused his stomach to rumble and nearly sent him off into the forest to 
track and bring down something to ease the growing pain in his belly.
But then, almost as if a natural reaction by now, he turned his head towards 
the sleeping Tavatron, knowing that he would have to go far in order to kill 
large enough prey to sate HIS hunger and how long it would take. And it 
would be too long to leave a sleeping bot alone like that, let alone leaving 
her unprotected in the first place.
With a sigh he then settled further against the sapling and made himself 
comfortable, ignoring the growing hunger pains in his stomach.
He�d eat later, AFTER he got her back to base.
So, for now he let her sleep and dream away whatever nice dreams he would 
never be able to have, and guarded her while she dreamt them. *
